result.execSummary:
The defendant Joey M. Keil was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Forgery-Uttering [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.38(2).
  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Defendant shall maintain full time employment or seek work at a rate of 3 job applications a week. Applications should be documented monthly to DOC.
Defendant shall document interview efforts with DOC.
Defendant shall provide a DNA sample.
Defendant shall pay financial obligations for Ct 1 directly to Clerk of Court. Court waives financial obligations for Ct 2.
Defendant shall pay restitution directly to Clerk of Court.

Defendant Joey M. Keil appeared by video, in custody from Dubuque County Jail.  Attorney Anthony Joseph Pozorski Sr. in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Peter A. Bartelt appeared by video for Joey M. Keil. Per agreement, defendant will be pleading to both counts. State will be recommending probation for 2 years on Ct 1 and 1 year probation for Ct 2 with the following conditions: to pay restitution (joint and several), maintain full time employment or seek work at a rate of 3 job applications weekly and document with DOC monthly, pay court costs, and to provide a DNA sample. Defendant pleads no contest to charges. Court reviews plea questionnaire and finds defendant freely and knowingly waives rights. Court accepts defendants plea and finds him guilty of Cts 1 and 2. Court reviews rights lost due to felony conviction. State heard. Attorney Bartelt heard. Defendant does not wish to be heard. Court heard and orders 2 years probation for Ct 1 and 1 year probation for Ct 2 with the following conditions: pay restitution-joint and several, maintain full time employment or seek work at a rate of 3 applications a week and document with DOC monthly, document interview efforts with DOC, pay court costs on Ct 1, costs on Ct 2 are waives, and to provide a DNA sample.

Defendant Joey M. Keil not in court.  Attorney Anthony Joseph Pozorski Sr. in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Peter A. Bartelt in court for Joey M. Keil. Defendant is currently at Dubuque County Jail. Attorney Bartelt heard on status of case and requests a plea and sentencing date. Court authorizes warrant. Plea and sentencing date set.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 27, 2022 at 04:00 pm.

Jury trial scheduled for August 9, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Joey M. Keil in court.  Attorney Anthony Joseph Pozorski Sr. in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant cannot afford to retain counsel. Court refers defendant to SPD and return. Defendant returns and qualifies for SPD. Counsel will be assigned. Preliminary hearing set.

Preliminary hearing on May 24, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Joey M. Keil appeared by video, in custody from Grant County Jail.  Attorney Anthony Joseph Pozorski Sr. in court for State of Wisconsin. Court explains charges, penalties, and right to counsel. State requests signature bond. Court orders $1000 signature bond. Status date set.
